name: Quantum-Kernel-Alignment
description: Quantum kernel alignment algorithm that learns, on a given dataset, a quantum kernel maximizing the SVM classification margin.

parameters.name: feature_map
parameters.description: An instance of FeatureMapForrelation in dictionary format used to map classical data into a quantum state space.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: NxD array of training data, where N is the number of samples and D is the feature dimension.

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Nx1 array of +/-1 labels of the N training samples.

parameters.name: lambda_initial
parameters.description: Initial parameters of the quantum feature map. If not specified, an array of randomly generated numbers is used.

parameters.name: spsa_steps
parameters.description: Number of SPSA optimization steps. Default is 10.

parameters.name: C
parameters.description: Penalty parameter for the soft-margin support vector machine. Default is 1.

return_values.name: aligned_kernel_parameters
return_values.description: The optimized kernel parameters found from quantum kernel alignment.

return_values.name: aligned_kernel_matrix
return_values.description: The aligned quantum kernel matrix evaluated with the optimized kernel parameters on the training data.

name: Circuit-Runner
description: A runtime program that takes one or more circuits, compiles them, executes them on the selected backend, and returns the results.

parameters.name: circuits
parameters.description: A circuit or a list of circuits to compile and execute.
parameters.type: A QuantumCircuit or a list of QuantumCircuits.

parameters.name: initial_layout
parameters.description: Initial position of virtual qubits on physical qubits.

parameters.name: instruction_durations
parameters.type: A list of tuples: [(instruction_name, qubits, duration, unit), ...].

parameters.name: seed_transpiler
parameters.description: Sets random seed for the stochastic parts of the transpiler.

parameters.name: optimization_level
parameters.description: How much optimization to perform on the circuits (0-3). Higher levels generate more optimized circuits. Default is 1.
